translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The Direction of Order and Disorder, the Triad with the Direction of Order, the Triad with the Direction of Disorder

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽15.68. Niyataduka, Kusalattika🔽Niyataṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyato nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Aniyataṁ🔽kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyato nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve.🔽Niyataṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyato naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Aniyataṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyato naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  niyata duka kusala ttika  niyatam kusalam dhammam paṭicca na niyataḥ na kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā aniyata  kusalam dhammam paṭicca na niyataḥ na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā dve pe avigate dve  niyatam akusalam dhammam paṭicca na niyataḥ na akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  aniyatam akusalam dhammam paṭicca na niyataḥ na akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: The Fixed Triad, the Wholesome Triad

original: Hetuyā dve …pe… avigate dve. (Abyākatamūle dve paccayavasena.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve pe avigate dve abyākata mūle dve paccaya vasena
translated: With a fixed wholesome state as condition, an unfixed unwholesome state arises, a condition being by way of root condition. With an unfixed wholesome state as condition, an unfixed unwholesome state arises, a condition being by way of root condition.
